data.text: @scientificecon Sorry but basic statistics would show that this is simply because vaccinated group is 20x larger than unvaccinated? And given that no vaccine is 100% effective then this would be expected. No?
@scientificecon @cshell_eh They won't let your link open.
@scientificecon You need to account for the fact that the vaccinated group is 20x larger than the other group. This is really basic statistics.
@scientificecon Mathâ€¦..80% of zero is ZERO. Wake up people.
@Econemotions @scientificecon I think those are absolute numbers, i.e. not in relation to the size of each group, so i think no.

@scientificecon I'm not an unreserved vaccine supporter but those are absolute numbers. In relation to the size of each group, i would expect C19 mortality rate to be lower among the vaccinated. None of this however says anything about wether it's a good idea to mass vaccinate everyone by force.
@scientificecon Safe & effective. Let this association sink in.https://t.co/fEaixu9hIe

@scientificecon All wars are terrible, but total genocide of mankind is something beyond that. Billions of life. Most civilians. And radioactive fall out with famine to destroy every last one of them over time. 

One has to make a stand against it, there is zero excuse for that.
